author: {'steamid': '76561198240408660', 'num_games_owned': 1480, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1690977033}
review:
[h1]Not only looks as [i][b]EarthBound[/b][/i], it’s so magical and memorable as [i][b]EarthBound[/b][/i]. And the most accomplished narrative experiment seen since [i][b]The Stanley Parable[/b][/i]. An unforgettable experience about the necessity of communicating with others to overcome our traumas[/h1]

We currently live immersed in the most creative an eclectic single period in videogame history thanks to the current indie scene. Not only as a consequence of the creation of new game concepts, but also to the revision of genres of the past adding new innovative elements. It’s amazing to think that only in the JRPG influenced genre using 16 bits aesthetics, we have seen in a year interval 5 of the all-time greatest classics in the form of [i]Lisa[/i], [i]Always Sometimes Monsters[/i], [i]Undertale[/i], [i]Hylics[/i] and [i]Why Am I Dead At Sea[/i]. With each one being a different deviation of the classic structure putting a lot of new ideas to the table. While they maintain some recognizable premises and mechanics to appeal to the players most beloved memories, using the nostalgia as a tool to generate vivid emotions. And most importantly, each of these 5 masterpieces can equal and even surpass the original referenced titles. If we look at the past, we can see that not even in the most creative and fertile period for JRGP games in the mid-90s, we could find a single year with such a sum of instant classics.

But between all these masterpieces, [i]Lisa[/i], [i]Undertale[/i], [i]Hylics[/i] and [i]Always Sometimes Monsters[/i], I think that [i]Why Am I Dead At Sea[/i] is a leap forward from the rest. Because it is not only a brilliant and almost perfect JRPG influenced classic with a plethora of charisma in which every second is an immense pleasure, full of magic and unforgettable moments. It’s also a great achievement in its use of an interactive narrative element to create strong emotional ties between characters. With each one being infused with his own and complex psychological behavior. That can evolve based in the affective interactions created with other persons as part of life.

And with one of the most mature writings seen in a videogame. Introducing a lot of complex subjects like suicidal motivations, illness, unrequited love, consumerism, third world poverty, psychological reasoning beneath violence, youthful frustrated dreams, lack of communication, isolation, false appearances and the existence of two personalities living inside every single person, the one that he shows to the rest of the world and how he perceives himself. And all of this without forgetting its videogame nature, emphasizing the fun factor with the use of fantastical elements and a lot of winks destined to drawing a joyful smile in our faces.

Its playable mechanic is based on the idea of being the floating spirit of a dead person that needs to reconstruct his memories. So he/she needs to posses the body of the rest of characters in the game to gathering information. This idea on paper looks simple, but has an infinite number of variations and complex sub-mechanics. There is two types of possessions. With one of them, we incarnate the role of the other person, seeing the world from his eyes perspective. And with the second possession, we supplant his body, acting based on our own conscience that is molded by the clues found in the form of saved memories. And finally, we have a mental skill that permits us to trespass the subconscious of a character without taking his body. This mental plane is expressed in the form of a psychedelic alternate reality.

Based in the person or role that we incarnate, every single character in the game will react in a different manner and the subjects of conversation will change. Also, each possessed character has his own special ability. While we incarnate the role of a female writer, we can push a button during a conversation to analyze the psychological motivations of the other character. With a thief, we can see the objects that the other character carries in his pockets. And the special ability of a depressive person is to ingest antidepressant pills, seeing a distorted reality for some seconds.

In order to be able to possess another person, we need to previously reach a spiritual connection with him. Learning about his feelings, hopes and inner fears. And about his world envision and philosophy of life. To could reach this short of spiritual connection with a character in the game, we are obligated to interact with him using the rest of bodies and personalities until he opens his heart.

[i]Why Am I Dead At Sea[/i] is a piece of interactive fiction that primarily talks about the healing effects of communicating with others as the only manner to overcome our traumas. Under the assumption that no man is a desert island. 

This accomplished use of narrative comes accompanied by an evocative graphic design inspired in [i]Earthbound[/i]. An by a captivating soundtrack composed by Bill Kiley, that with a single game has put his name close to some of the most iconic musicians in gaming history, evoking Yasunori Mitsuda or Jake Kaufman most iconic works.

If you are one of these people obsessed with numbers, I can say that [i]Why Am I Dead At Sea[/i] is a perfect [b]10/10[/b]. And my most firm candidate to the [b]Best Game of 2015[/b].

[i]( The writer of this review is not an English native. So you should expect occasional grammar errors. I apologize in advance. )[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970244175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1442982858}
review: Loved it. The possession mechanics present a unique way to get to know each of the characters and their stories, which are the heart of this game. The art and music bring a certain charm that's reminiscent of titles such as Earthbound. If you're looking for a game with a great story, interesting characters, and challenging puzzles, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085419989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1442834344}
review:
It's a great game, I played the previous free instalments on newgrounds and loved the series straight away, it's a refreshingly original gameplay, the plot is intriguing and well thought out, the puzzles aren't too complicated but still satisfyingly challenging. I haven't managed to yet unlock all the achievements though I have won most of them.
I absolutely love the concept of multiple endings. 
Well done, hope to see another episode sometime in the near future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084941880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1436802168}
review:
This game was released on my Birthday so I thought I'd give it a free 'Lets try this game' card!

Okay so pros: This game is actually well written, I love all the characters individualities and I love how it can throw me off what I believed to be the story.
Cons: It's not always easy being able to tell what you need to do and there are a number of glitches that take ages to get around.

Still, I haven't finished the game just yet but I do find this highly enjoyable!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059561891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 416, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1433982600}
review:
Why Am I Dead At Sea locks on to a pretty solid formula and adds a murderous flair to it. Story driven games like To the Moon and Last Word are classic examples of narrative over action. You don't need flashy graphics and explosions to make a good game. Dead At Sea captures this in natural style with its supernatural themes. From the moment you begin to play, your immediately entranced. You are given the powers of possession and to read minds and set loose aboard a vessel with a unique ensemble of characters. Someone aboard the vessel is your murderer. Can you find out who? Through conversation, puzzles, and a little bit of trickery. You will guide your ghastly visage in a tale that takes many twists and turns. With multiple endings adding even more layers of complexity to the story. Graphically the game is akin to a darker Earthbound style of avatars. It feels like an RPGMaker style game but is different and unique enough that I appreciate. The music is used quite effectively as the tone of the game shifts. As you possess different characters, enter different rooms, or read minds. I liked this quite a bit. The music gave personality to each of the characters and scenes. 
In all it was very difficult to find anything really wrong with the game. It's bug free and plays well. The only problem I found was that the momentum of the game was hard to maintain. With little direction given to the player as to what to do next. The goals were sometimes obscure and confusing. Only being made clear by constantly running back to your guide. This caused the game to drag a bit. As I constantly kept having to find the target I needed to possess over and over as they move about the ship. This lead to some frustrating moments. Nonetheless Why Am I Dead At Sea is a fantastic story and a example of how to do story driven game.

I made a video review to show off some of the features and gameplay of this game!
https://youtu.be/KGSbCC5jDzM
I hope you enjoy!
Martyr

author: {'steamid': '76561198120260420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1444973215}
review:
Very enticing game with a decent level of originality to the concept of "You're a ghost, possess things". The writing is excellent, and will pull you right into the story.

Puzzles, while sometimes a tad mundane, feel fairly rewarding as each one unravels subplots that connect to the bigger picture. It's almost like a "whodunnit" movie that'll keep you curious as you play.

The game isn't without it's problems though, there's a lot of running back and forth, and some puzzles can be a tad tough to figure out once you no longer have Paulo to resort to for hints. Overall it's a great game if you're looking for a gripping storyline.

Quick thoughts video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=np1CVvIRD4U

author: {'steamid': '76561198015029217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1607543952}
review:
Un excellent jeu. Particulièrement pour son scénario, et pour l'atmosphère qui s'en dégage (appui de la bande son et de la qualité du déploiement psychologique des personnages). Je le conseille particulièrement à ceux qui aiment suivre une histoire, il n'y a ni scène de combats, ni besoin de réflexe, etc.

Autres rares bémols : quelques légers bugs (sous couvert de future correction), peut-être un manque de clarté pur obtenir toutes les fins. Mais bon y a les guides pour ça hein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114564907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1444609347}
review:
This game is phenomenal. The dialogue is very well written, the storyline is fantastic, and it connects to the previous games in the series in a way that still allows people who haven't played them to understand and enjoy this game.

Pros:
- Brilliant storyline
- Multiple endings, so more than one playthrough
- Interesting characters with unlockable backstories

Cons: 
- Still some visual glitches (characters trying to move and getting stuck on objects or other characters)
- There are parts where you just have to walk around and talk to everyone as everyone else, which can make the story hard to progress
- The save feature is frustrating - you have to either copy a file multiple times or just start from the beginning to get all of the endings

Overall, I love this game. I frequently would stop playing for a while and immediately come back to thinking about the characters and the killer, which is a rare quality not found in many games. I highly recommend playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067615753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1569133802}
review: I thoroughly enjoyed this game. The clues are fair and it is fun and rewarding to get them through the characters. Sometimes it took a little thinking to figure out who could access the right bit of dialogue from who, but if you pay attention to what is said, there are plenty of hints about what to do. The game is interesting in it's mechanics, story and enthralling design. Some dialogue nearly moved me to tears. Don't miss out on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014259206', 'num_games_owned': 675, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1495, 'last_played': 1543282634}
review:
Give this game a try if you enjoy puzzle adventure games, pretty enjoyable and if I hadn't gotten all the achievements I would still be playing just for the OST alone.
Isn't too hard or long either; most of my hours were made up from me just chilling to the music.
[Update]
Recently replayed the game again, and reached an ending in about 5 hours.
Still fun to play after all this time, and saw something new I missed!
Seems the developer updates the game for bugs and even more language support.
I wish for 2020 for more games by the same developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041046691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1523310719}
review:
Like other reviewers said, this game is very enjoyable.  This review being constructive feedback is not because the game is not excellent.  I expected it to be great and it is, there are just a few things I think could make playing it a bit easier.

Having the full unlock on the characters just essentially double the number of characters I had to control to test all the conversation options.  It would be nice if the characters whom you could share knowledge with, just had that added when you possessed them instead of having two kinds of possession.  Some characters were also unable to start conversations with certain people or open doors when super possessed.  

Also programming the boy to tell us which character we need to talk from, or which character we need to talk to, in order to advance would be very helpful. it was 8x8 conversation testing to see if any of the conversations changed sometimes, and 16x8 with the second possession type, and then another multiplier of like 4 for each dialogue the new content might be in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016432675', 'num_games_owned': 1503, 'num_reviews': 483, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1433381381}
review:
[b] Target Audience: [/b] [I]  Mystery Fans [/i]

[b] Summary: [/b]  

Why am I Dead At Sea hits the points it needs to for the genre, as the narrative and interesting characters set a decent backdrop for this murder mystery. Attempting to figure out how you died and taking control of people via possession is a fun mechanic, and there are little touches that really help the game out like characters having their own music, and their own abilities. This does have the old school adventure game logic however: you will get frustrated wondering what is going on and will run around trying to figure out what you missed. And certain bugs can pop up that can halt all progress, which is a problem. But even with that said, it's a great narriative that will help those gamers lookinjgj for a mystery experience. 

[b]Gameplay Footage and Video Review:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g27FrJ0yhH8[/b] 

[u] Lists: [/u]
[b]Positives:[/b]
[list]
[*] Great narrative and a good set of writing here. Gives you reasons to get into the plot in question and makes you really want to see what happens next.
[*] Character variety is strong and keeps the mystery going, even when a character or two is eliminated as a possible suspect. Backstories help connect you to these characters on an emotional level.
[*] Music is appropriate for every character, and really helps bring their mood and emotional state to life. 
[*] Good visuals, and change of scenery when it happens. It's not a big game, but something has changed (in particular the outside), it works rather well.
[*] Gets the mystery portion of the game down without reaching to do it. Doesn't force the element, which is critical in a good mystery plot.
[/list]

[b]Negatives:[/b]
[list]
[*] Trial and Error gameplay logic. Keep a notepad with you to write down what you did and didn't do. A couple of tools could have been used to help this in terms of not repeating actions you've done already.
[*] Some bugs seemingly (this is not CONFIRMED on my side) stop progress entirely. 
[*] Some characters lack of personality change with unveiling of certain items hurts overall connection to characters.
[*] Wish the mind reading mechanic had a tiny bit more use to it. Was fun, but ultimately didn't do much overall. 
[/list]

[b] If you want more reviews/information regarding games I've reviewed, visit my curator. [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861768/]Dragnix Curator [/url][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198178935238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1555652457}
review:
Очень жалко, что эта игра не стала популярной и очень мало игроков знает о ней.
Автор игры до создания "Why Am I Dead At Sea" создал еще несколько(2) частей этой замечательной серии на флэше, которые я в своё время отыскал и прошел вдоль и поперёк на портале Newgrounds.com. Я не могу сказать, что это прям какой-то супер шедевр или что-то невообразимое. Вовсе нет. Игра небольшая, простая рисовка с закосом на "Earthbound". Но в ней есть что-то особенное и уникальное, что смогло меня влюбить в неё. А я поверьте тот еще придира. Если у вас есть 4-5 часов времени и вы хотите их провести с полным погружением в атмосферу и сюжет, то рекомендую.

+ Очень интересный и захватывающий сюжет
+ Симпатичная пиксельная графика, напоминающая "Earthbound"
+ Отличный саундтрек
+ Несколько концовок, зависящих от ваших действий в игре
+ Живые и интересные персонажи
+ Атмосфера

- Иногда встречаются баги, но они не смертельные.

Знание английского обязательно(!).
Рекомендую всем любителям хороших адвенчур.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123146294', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1511909232}
review:
After playing a couple minutes of this game, I was instantly hooked to the story line. Great character development is portrayed in this game. As you get to learn more about what the characters, it also lets you learn new things about yourself  and how you feel emotionally. I personally am overwhelmed on how this game has affected me because you can relate/sympathize with the characters from their backstories that are later uncovered in the game. 

The gameplay can be really challenging. For me, at some objectives it took awhile to figure out what to do but eventually I did find solutions. There are times where you may get stuck, and repeat conversations with different characters to see what you missed which can be quite time consuming. Despite that, the storyline is amazing; sometimes humorous, other times really dark and leaves you thinking alot about...idk life and reality. Overall, this game is great for people who love a good mystery or into story telling type games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994880958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1431484051}
review:
There have been a few games where you're the ghost of your dead self trying to solve the case of your murder, but not nearly enough in my opinion. Some have been good, some fantastic, some you should never touch, luckily this one's a good one.

PROS:
*Opinionated but, the art style is great.
*Multiple Endings. I've only gotten the one so far, but I actually want to go discover the others, which I never do unless the true ending is only unlockable after doing all of the others. This doesn't seem to be the case here, though, it's all based on what all you can discover.
*Great Soundtrack.
*Fantastic Story.

CONS:
*Bugs. Bugs everywhere. Granted I'm writing this a couple days after release, so they may get patched.
*As much as I like the game's storytelling, getting to that storytelling can be a bit of a hassle sometimes. Even if you listen to everything a person has to say, you may be doing it as the wrong person, and in some cases, it isn't really apparent who the right person is, so you just have to talk to everyone as everyone. There are slight clues tucked away sometimes, but there was a small chunk of the game early on where I just had no idea what I was supposed to do next.

7.5/10 Right now, 8/10 When certain bugs are fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091304696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1431502896}
review: This isn't so much a game as it is a story that you slowly dig up as you talk to each character with each character. It was frustrating when I didn't know what to do, but for every moment when I had a lead, I was hooked. The story is joy to unravel, since the game rewards you for searching for clues. There's a lot here that you could miss, and still finish the game. I'm sure there's a lot I missed, and I'm pretty sure I got the "good" ending. For ten bucks, it's definitely worth playing, though you may want to wait till there are decent guides for when you get stuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152591734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1527567154}
review: Amazing! The mystery is engrossing and the puzzle aspect is "what to do where, who to talk with who" which makes it unique. It is HARD, so warning! But it is COMPLETELY worth the struggling through. This game is for true strategy/mystery game lovers, NOT for the casual gamer. So if you are up to a challenge and a good story, check this game out!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998063143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1430972069}
review:
So, I've been following this game ever since I saw the trailer; something about the Earthbound inspired environments really caught my eye.  It's not a clone by any means; Earthbound was a true turn-based RPG while this is a more puzzle-y narrative-driven adventure with a supernatural twist.

The good:
-Great pixel graphics and environments
-Great character work; each person has a different personality, motives, secrets and strengths
-These differences are more interesting when you possess them in order to find out what happened to you
-Diving into people's minds was executed very well
-I really got invested in wanting to find out what makes these people tick and what happened to me
-The music in the game is fun and true to their retro roots
-Tons of unique dialogue to trigger depending on who you are 
-Great throwbacks to Earthbound

Cons:
-Not a wide variety of music to hear; can get a little repetitive as you walk around
-Some of the puzzles are difficult to figure out (Who needs to do what and where? Etc.) which leads to some extra wandering around
-Can be difficult to tell who is talking when you are learning who is who; dialogue boxes could have been positioned more over the person talking instead of centered on the screen
-Which there was more interactivity with mind-reading (A mini-game to learn secrets would have been cool, or literally explore their mind (Like Alundra on PSX?) and unlock secrets that way.)


Disclosure: I was provided a complimentary advanced copy by the developer for review purposes and I was not compensated any other way. All opinions are my own.
